column4: how to change the boot sequence on startup....need to have the CD/DVD be first in line...where do I look/set this option?? Thanks in advance...
I guess BIOS still accessible via F1 option on boot-up??
thanks, john00...will try both options...
yeah I could go to HP's website...I've seen it there...
problem I'm having is getting BackTrack 5 to boot on my HP laptop...
so I figured maybe setting the CD/DVD drive to boot first might correct the problem...
the guys in #backtracklinux can help with that
sorry, #backtrack-linux
they will get there, hang in with them
plus, I'm in the channel and I don't see you asking in that channel in the last 7 days
ok, so try their channel as I've just told you
type "/join #backtrack-linux"
- you say its looking for trouble when I know that it's possible...
1.) it's called "Windows" not "windoze"

2.) I'd advise you not to depend on Wine to run games on linux, my view is that Windows games are designed to run on Windows, and trying to use them on other operating systems/depending on a solution is just trouble
I'd advise you to stay clear of PlayOnLinux and Wine as a solution for games
- sorry but your wrong because I know it's possible just don't know how to do it...
what do you mean "I'm wrong"
I didn't say it wasn't possible
there are abstraction layers tools such as "wine" (playonlinux is a front end to that)

however depending on them is not a solution as not all games work, games can work badly, games can work fine one day, then not work at all the next day, hence depending on the solution is "looking for trouble"
the guys in #winehq can walk you through your wine journey should you choose to progress it
- exactly...so where do I go to get it running?? I had PlayOnLinux installed on this laptop when I had OpenSUSE on it but could not figure out how to get it running...
- I'll try there...
